se.jguru.nazgul.core.resource.api.extractor

Class JarExtractor

  • java.lang.Object
    • se.jguru.nazgul.core.resource.api.extractor.JarExtractor

  • public abstract class JarExtractor
extends Object
    Trivial utility which extracts resources from a (self-contained) JAR. Also provides utility methods to simplify finding JarFiles originating from URLs to resources placed within JARs.
    Author:
    Lennart Jörelid, jGuru Europe AB

    • Method Detail

      • getJarFileFor

        public static JarFile getJarFileFor(URL packagedResourceURL)
                             throws IllegalArgumentException
        Acquires the JarFile for the supplied packageResourceURL, which should be pointing to a resource packaged within a JAR. The first/outermost protocol for the supplied packagedResourceURL must be "jar", as a normal JAR resource URL has the form jar:file:/some/path/aJarFile.jar!/path/in/jar/aFile.txt, where the path part is operating system dependent. (For instance, the windows counterpart could start with something like jar:file:/C:/some/path/aJarFile.jar!/path/in/jar/aFile.txt).
        Parameters:
        packagedResourceURL - a non-null URL pointing to a resource packaged within a JAR.
        Returns:
        The JarFile for the JAR within which the packagedResourceURL is found.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the supplied URL did not correspond to a resource packaged within a JAR.

      • getEntryNameFor

        public static String getEntryNameFor(URL packagedResourceURL)
        Retrieves the JarEntry name for the supplied packagedResourceURL. Typically, this value can be used to acquire a JarEntry for the 
             
         // Get the JarFile for a JAR-based URL
         final JarFile foundJarFile = JarExtractor.getJarFileFor(resourceInJarURL);

         // Now, find the JarEntry name for the given resourceInJarURL
         final String name = JarExtractor.getEntryNameFor(resourceInJarURL);

         // Get the JarEntry for the resourceInJarURL
         final JarEntry entry = foundJarFile.getJarEntry(name);
        Parameters:
        packagedResourceURL - A JAR URL, which must contain an '!' char. Typically on a form similar to jar:file:/some/path/aJarFile.jar!/path/in/jar/aFile.txt
        Returns:
        The entry name of the URL, which is the part following the '!/' char. Note that the first '/' must be peeled off to retrieve a valid JarEntry name.

      • extractResourcesFrom

        public static void extractResourcesFrom(JarFile jarFile,
                                        Pattern resourceIdentifier,
                                        File targetDirectory,
                                        boolean createTargetDirectoryIfNonexistent)
        Extracts all resources whose names matches the supplied resourceIdentifier from jarFile to the targetDirectory. If targetDirectory does not exist and the createTargetDirectoryIfNonexistent parameter is true, the directory (and any parent directories) will be created.
        Parameters:
        jarFile - The JAR file from which some resources should be extracted.
        resourceIdentifier - A Pattern matching the names of all resources which should be extracted.
        targetDirectory - The directory to which all resources should be extracted.
        createTargetDirectoryIfNonexistent - if true, the targetDirectory will be created if it does not already exist.
